title: Mark Meadows seeks to move Fulton County election interference case to federal court
description: Meadows, who was Trump's White House chief of staff, argues that the charges against him pertain to actions he took while serving in the Trump administration.

title: Sponsor cuts ties with YouTube star who said she wanted international wine expert 'dead'
description: Tana Mongeau threatened the wine tour guide on her podcast, which led to harassment and negative reviews. Babbel, who sponsored Mongeau, says it's cutting ties.

title: Maui wildfire becomes latest fodder for disaster conspiracy theorists
description: As Maui reckons with one of the deadliest wildfires in recent U.S. history, it is also dealing with social media-fueled conspiracy theories.

title: Sage Steele and ESPN part ways after settling lawsuit
description: Broadcaster Sage Steele left ESPN, both the company and Steele announced Tuesday.

title: Rudy Giuliani charged with breaking the type of law he helped innovate as a prosecutor
description: Rudy Giuliani made groundbreaking use of RICO laws when he was a federal prosecutor. Now, he's facing a similar charge himself along with former President Trump.

title: U.S. watchdog to announce plans to regulate 'surveillance industry'
description: The top U.S. agency for consumer financial protection will announce plans  to regulate companies that track and sell people’s personal data.

title: Eyes on 2024: Trump's rivals mostly silent (so far) on indictment
description: Most of Trump’s top rivals for the GOP nomination have not yet weighed in on Trump's Georgia indictment, with two exceptions.

title: Cellphone etiquette 101: When and where to talk on the phone
description: Almost everyone has an opinion on when and where it’s appropriate to talk on the phone. Jenna Bush Hager takes part in a social experiment to find out what people think when it comes to cell phone consideration.

title: What the Georgia election charges against Trump mean
description: Former President Donald Trump has been indicted in the 2020 presidential election probe in Georgia and faces felony racketeering and numerous conspiracy charges, court filings show. NBC’s Kristen Welker and Laura Jarrett provided analysis for TODAY on what the charges mean.

title: Trial timeline uncertain in Trump Georgia indictment
description: NBC News legal analysts Danny Cevallos and Carol Lam discuss the timing of a trial in the indictment of former President Trump and 18 others in Georgia.

title: District attorney speaks after Trump indicted in Georgia
description: Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis lists the names and charges after former President Donald Trump and 18 others were indicted as part of an investigation into efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

title: These are the 13 new charges against Trump
description: Trump was charged with 13 counts in the 41-count indictment leveled against 19 defendants.

title: Trump charged in Georgia election case
description: A grand jury has indicted former President Donald Trump for his alleged efforts to overturn Georgia's 2020 election results.

title: Georgia grand jury returns indictments in Trump election probe
description: A grand jury has delivered an indictment in  District Attorney Fani Willis's investigation into former President Donald Trump and the 2020 election.
